twooter

Class TwooterClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • twooter.TwooterClient

  • public class TwooterClient
extends java.lang.Object

    The official Twooter client library for Java!

    To help prevent spam, this client prohibits more than 20 service requests per second and will automatically rate-limit further requests to reduce the network load.

    As many of the methods here use network functions to communicate with a server, they also tend to emit IOExceptions when network errors occur. It is recommended that you handle any exceptions as close to the call causing them as possible otherwise your applications are likely to just bomb out completely on very minor issues.

    Remember that exceptions can be directly printed: System.out.println( someErrorObject ); to examine the cause of the error.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwooterClient

        public TwooterClient()

        Creates a new client instance

        This does not by default connect to the live feed, if you want this functionality, you will need to implement at least one listener and call enableLiveFeed().

        Excepting the live feed, this class makes no persistent connections, and each request will be serviced individually. This means that instances of the TwooterClient object can be created and no network requests will be performed until one of the methods is called.

    • Method Detail

      • addUpdateListener

        public void addUpdateListener(UpdateListener m)
        Add an object implementing the UpdateListener interface to the list of objects to be notified on live feed events.
        Parameters:
        m - The listening object to add
        See Also:
        UpdateListener

      • removeUpdateListener

        public void removeUpdateListener(UpdateListener m)
        Removes the supplied object from the event listener list, halting any further events from being sent to it.
        Parameters:
        m - The listening object to remove
        See Also:
        UpdateListener

      • enableLiveFeed

        public boolean enableLiveFeed()

        Enables (and connects to) the live feed service.

        From this point on any objects listening for updates will start receiving events.

        Note: This method may fail (due to network errors, for example) check the return for if it succeeded

        Returns:
        True, if successfully connected and started

      • disableLiveFeed

        public boolean disableLiveFeed()

        Disables (and disconnects from) the live feed service.

        From this point, any all events will cease to all listening objects, and the DISCONNECT event will be issued.

        Note: This method may fail (due to network errors, for example) check the return for if it succeeded

        Returns:
        True if successfully disconnected and shut down

      • isFeedConnected

        public boolean isFeedConnected()

        Used to determine if the live feed is connected for this client.

        Note that this does not mean that events will be forwarded - this still requires that there is at least one listening object added via addEventListener()

        Returns:
        True if the feed is connected.

      • isUp

        public boolean isUp()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to determine if the web service is both online and reachable.
        Returns:
        True, if the server can be communicated with, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown

      • registerName

        public java.lang.String registerName(java.lang.String name)
                              throws java.io.IOException

        Attempt to register a new username.

        This method registers a username with the online service, and returns a token string, which must be used when the user wants to post a message or when renewing the username.

        Usernames expire after 48 hours if not renewed.

        Parameters:
        name - The requested username. The maximum length is 32 characters.
        Returns:
        The token for this username if it can be created, or 'null' if the user already exists.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.

      • isActiveName

        public boolean isActiveName(java.lang.String name)
                     throws java.io.IOException

        Contacts the Twooter service to check if a name exists and is active.

        While you can use this as part of registering a name, the registerName() name is atomic, and will check if a name exists anyway before attempting to register it afresh.

        Parameters:
        name - The name to query
        Returns:
        True, if the name exists, else false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.

      • refreshName

        public boolean refreshName(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String token)
                    throws java.io.IOException

        Refresh the token timeout for a particular username.

        This method needs to be called every so often to keep the username alive on the Twooter service. When a username expires, all messages by that username are removed and the name it made available for other users to register with registerName().

        Parameters:
        name - The username to refresh the token timeout for. The maximum length is 32 characters.
        token - The token string for this user.
        Returns:
        True, if the refresh was a success, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws this exception if the underlying web request fails

      • postMessage

        public java.lang.String postMessage(java.lang.String token,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String message)
                             throws java.io.IOException

        Posts a message to the Twooter feed.

        Using a token and username (either saved from a previous session, or registered with registerName) this method attempts to post a message to the user's Twooter feed.

        If successful, this method will return a unique identifier for the post as a String, if it fails (for any reason) the method will return null;

        Messages on the Twooter service have a lifetime of 48 hours, after which they are automatically removed. There is no way to prevent a message from being removed.

        Parameters:
        token - The token string for this user.
        name - The username for this user. The maximum length is 32 characters.
        message - The message to post on the Twooter feed. The maximum length is 4096 characters.
        Returns:
        The unique String identifier for the post, if successful, or null otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.

      • getMessages

        public Message[] getMessages()
                      throws java.io.IOException

        Retrieves a small number of messages from Twooter service (up to a maximum of 30) and returns them as an Array of Messages.

        This method will always return the latest messages on the feed.

        Returns:
        An Array of Messages containing the latest messages from the Twooter feed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.
        See Also:
        Message

      • getMessages

        public Message[] getMessages(java.lang.String username)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a small number of messages from the Twooter service for a specific user (up to a maximum of 30 messages) and returns them as a Message array.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user you wish to view the feed for.
        Returns:
        An Array of Message objects for the latest messages from the users' Twooter feed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.
        See Also:
        Message

      • getMessage

        public Message getMessage(java.lang.String id)
                   throws java.io.IOException

        Retrieves a single message from Twooter, using the message ID.

        If the ID does not match any message (as would be the case for a message which has expired) then this method will return null;

        Parameters:
        id - A string ID for the message to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A twooter.Message object, if the message can be found, or null if none was found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.

      • getTagged

        public java.lang.String[] getTagged(java.lang.String tag)
                             throws java.io.IOException

        Retrieves a list of message IDs for messages tagged with the supplied tag.

        The server only considers tags which have only alphanumeric (a-z A-Z and 0-9) characters, underscores, or hyphens, everything else is just considered part of the message.

        If no messages have the tag, the method will return an empty array.

        Note that this method can return a lot of message IDs, be prepared for vast amounts of data.

        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to search, must start with a '#'.
        Returns:
        An array of messages IDs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the client has an internal error, an IOException will be thrown.
